task.title: Task: Rental cottage with variable price
task.shortdesc: An example of a data table with 2 input cells

context.p: A summer cottage can be rented for 350-600 dollars a week, the price depends on the season. The expenses are fixed on 175 dollars per week. Using a data table, calculate the revenues for 5, 10, 15, ..., 50 weeks and rental prices 350, 400, 450, â€¦ 600.

The data table will be in A7:G17. The two input cells are B3 (rental price) and B5 (number of rental weeks). In cell A7 is a formula with references to the two input cells. The values for input cell B3 are in row B7:G7. The values for input cell B5 are in column A8:A17.

step.cmd: Add in cell A7 the formula =B5*(B3-B4).
Select the range for the data table A7:G17.
Put the cursor in the box Row input cell and click on cell B3.
Put the cursor in box Column input cell and click on cell B5.

taskbody.result: The formula in the result cells is an array formula: {=TABLE(B3,B5)}. Check this.
